title: Eva Longoria creates mum squad goals with Cheryl and Victoria Beckham
text:
Eva Longoria has Cheryl and VB on hand for any mum queries (Picture: Getty/Rex)

Eva Longoria has officially assembled one of the best mum squads out there – with Cheryl and Victoria Beckham ready to give her a helping hand.

The Desperate Housewives star gave birth to Santiago Enrique Bastón in June 2018, her first child with husband Jose Baston, and dotes on her little bundle of joy.

Watching him grow up, she knows she’s in good company, and is looking to her close pals for help as he begins to get older.

Speaking on the red carpet at the Global Gift Gala, Eva told Metro.co.uk: ‘[Cheryl] is such a laugh and I really enjoy her company. We were talking baby things, because we’re both obsessed with our baby boys. We should have had a play date while I was here!’

‘Victoria’s an amazing mum,’ the star continued. ‘She’s probably one of the first people I do turn to for advice for things.

‘Plus her kids are older so she’s already been through all the stages already. Harper’s in love with Santi so that helps too. I have a built in babysitter.’

Eva wants to make the world a better place for her son (Picture: Getty)

The birth of baby Santi has had some unexpected repercussions for the star however, with Eva admitting her charity work is increasing because she wants to improve the world her son grows up in.

‘Once I became a mum, nothing surprises me. People asked me “what’s surprising” and I go “nothing”,’ she told us.

‘Then I realised my philanthropy became so much more intense. I actually have anxiety about leaving the world a better place now because of my son.

‘Like “Oh my God we have to do more!” The stakes are higher now.’

As part of her new work, Eva is a strong advocate for the Global Gift Foundation, who advocates philanthropic change by raising money for business initiatives and fundraising for the less fortunate.

Together with Global Gift Foundation, Eva launched the Girls In Action Alliance, which connects young girls with science, technology, engineering and maths education.
